title: Maryland asks state vaccine providers to pause J&J appointments for now
body: After the CDC and the FDA said Tuesday morning they were, the Maryland Department of Health is asking the state's vaccine providers to put appointments for that vaccine on hold.Gov. Hogan news conference"Based on the federal government’s recommendation and out of an abundance of caution, the Maryland Department of Health directs all Maryland COVID-19 vaccine providers to pause the administration of Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccines until further federal guidance is issued," a DOH statement says. "Providers should continue to maintain their supplies of Johnson & Johnson vaccines in a manner that prevents wastage."The two federal agencies are investigating potentially dangerous blood clots in six women in the days after vaccination, in combination with reduced platelet counts. More than 6.8 million doses of the J&J vaccine have been administered in the U.S.Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan took some comments after a groundbreaking event in Baltimore on Tuesday afternoon. He says that due to the pause of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine, FEMA mobile sites had to be shut down since they were using the J&J shot and the state had to cancel the walk-up Hagerstown site. "We're watching very carefully, and moving forward 'big time' with the other vaccines," Hogan said. He adds that any Maryland resident affected by the pause or the cancelation of their vaccine appointment can "come to any mass vaccination site and be taken care of right away."Hogan also says "very few" places were using the J&J vaccine and he says that vaccine sites should not be affected by the pause.
